intro: Cyrtandra prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It is a low-growing, herbaceous species that typically forms dense mats on the ground. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are often pale green or yellowish in color. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family, which includes many ornamental and horticulturally important species. Cyrtandra prostrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and coastal areas.
